thread.title: Top RB Kareem Walker visited Michigan but says he's still OSU commit
thread.title_full: Top RB Kareem Walker visited Michigan but says he's still OSU commit

author: freep.com
title: Top RB Kareem Walker visited Michigan but says he's still OSU commit
text:
MORE Michigan got the No. 1 running back in the 2016 recruiting class, Kareem Walker, to take an official visit to Ann Arbor two weeks ago , and it seemed like a clear shot at Ohio State, to which he is committed.
But Walker, a five-star prospect from Wayne, N.J., wants to make clear that he hasn't made any decisions, including leaving Ohio State's class.
He released a statement to espn.com's Tom VanHaaren today, saying he still is committed to the Buckeyes and will take his four remaining official visits to Alabama, Mississippi, Arizona State and Ohio State. He did not make a reference to Michigan in the statement.
This is the latest statement from RB Kareem Walker, sent today, on where he's at and what visits he'll take pic.twitter.com/aBruV2KJ1i
‚Äî Tom VanHaaren (@TomVH) October 21, 2015 Walker's U-M visit coincided with a lot of running back movement in the Big Ten. Wisconsin's top tailback commit, Antonio Williams, flipped to the Buckeyes last week, and then came news that Michigan is rescinding its football scholarship offer for injured Southfield commit Matt Falcon .
Michigan is playing on Walker's New Jersey roots, trying to convince him to join the three New Jersey players already in the class : receivers Ahmir Mitchell and Brad Hawkins and defensive end Ron Johnson.
According to a post from Mitchell, U-M is reaching out to three New Jersey targets still on the board: rivals.com's No. 2 overall player, defensive tackle Rashan Gary, No. 17-ranked athlete Jordan Fuller and No. 21 Walker. Mitchell posted a mailer like the ones sent to prospects. It has Jim Harbaugh's signature in the corner, which usually is verification that it came from the staff.
Some think of it as a dreamüí≠... Scary thing is, it can reality ‚ÄºÔ∏è„ÄΩÔ∏èüíé @RashanGary33 @j__fuller1 @_KareemWalker #NJ2AA pic.twitter.com/3fPOHJzE1d
